page.title: 06LOCAL WORK
page.content:
In a survey of the occupations of children's parents in our area, the men were employed in manual and unskilled work. None of them was a trained professional. Some were involved in the transport industries such as Leyland Motors and British Aerospace. A few provided services such as painting and decorating and carpet fitting. The remainder who had managed to secure work were employed locally in the few available jobs in the area.
The mothers who worked were found to be mainly in part-time occupations such as shop assistants, cleaners and general helpers in schools and social services establishments. None of the mothers had trained for a profession.
